Based on the UN World Water Development Report 2022 theme "Making the Invisible Visible," the core challenges are:
Groundwater depletion happening silently (99% of liquid freshwater but poorly monitored) Fragmented monitoring with no centralized system Unregulated extraction and overuse Water quality degradation Poor governance coordination across agencies Climate change vulnerability Agricultural dependence with no data-driven planning
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  1. ServiceNow Customer Service Management (CSM)
    Use Case:
    Citizen portal for well registration, permit applications, and complaint management
    Capabilities:
    Multi-channel service delivery (web, mobile, helpline, chatbot)
    Well registration and permit application workflows
    Knowledge base for water conservation practices
    Complaint logging for water quality issues, illegal borewells
    SLA tracking for permit processing
    Self-service portal for farmers and citizens
    Case management for water quality incidents
  2.   ServiceNow IT Operations Management (ITOM) & IoT Intelligence
    Use Case:
    Real-time monitoring of IoT sensors across wells and borewells
    Capabilities:
    Integration with IoT water level sensors, flow meters, and quality monitors
    Real-time data ingestion from thousands of monitoring points
    Automated anomaly detection (sudden drawdown, contamination spikes)
    Alert generation for threshold breaches
    Device health monitoring and maintenance alerts
    Time-series data storage and analysis
  3. ServiceNow Performance Analytics Use Case:
    Aquifer health dashboards and trend analysis
    Capabilities:
    Interactive dashboards showing water levels, extraction rates, and quality by region
    Predictive analytics for water availability forecasting
    Benchmarking across districts and water basins
    Custom KPIs: sustainable yield, stress index, recharge efficiency
    Trend analysis for seasonal variations and long-term depletion
    Impact assessment of interventions (recharge projects, restrictions)
    Climate correlation analysis
  4. ServiceNow Integration HubUse Case:
    Connect diverse data sources and external systems
    Capabilities:
    Integration with weather stations and meteorological departments
    Connection to satellite remote sensing data (GRACE, Sentinel)
    Agricultural department systems (crop patterns, irrigation)
    Geological survey databases
    Water quality laboratories (LIMS integration)
    Electric utility data (power consumption as proxy for pumping)
    GIS systems for spatial analysis
    Payment gateways for water charges and permit fees
  5. ServiceNow Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC)Use Case:
    Regulatory compliance and policy enforcement
    Capabilities:
    Policy library management (national, state, local regulations)
    Compliance tracking for permit holders
    Risk assessment for over-exploited aquifers
    Audit management for water usage
    Violation tracking and penalty management
    Environmental impact assessment workflows
    Automated reporting to regulatory bodies
  6. ServiceNow Field Service Management (FSM)
    Dispatch inspection teams and maintenance crews
    Capabilities:
    Work order management for field inspections
    Technician dispatch and scheduling
    Route optimization for well surveys
    Equipment tracking (water quality kits, GPS devices)
    Mobile access for field teams
    Preventive maintenance for monitoring equipment
  7. ServiceNow Predictive Intelligence
    Use Case:
    AI-powered forecasting and anomaly detection
    Capabilities:
    Machine learning models for water level prediction
    Anomaly detection for unusual extraction patterns
    Demand forecasting based on historical patterns
    Clustering similar aquifer behaviors
    Automated incident classification
    Predictive maintenance for sensors

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • ServiceNow (CSM, ITOM/IoT, Performance Analytics, Integration Hub, Mobile Studio, GRC, FSM)
  • IoT sensors (water level, flow meters, quality monitors)
  • GIS integration (ArcGIS/Google Maps)
  • Satellite data (GRACE, Sentinel)
  • Weather APIs and climate models
  • Laboratory systems (LIMS)
  • Power utility data
  • Mobile infrastructure (iOS/Android apps)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

 

  • Ground-level resistance (mitigation: subsidies, community ownership, transparency)
  • Electricity subsidies (mitigation: delink subsidy from consumption, solar pumps)
  • Sensor maintenance (mitigation: rugged design, community guardianship)
  • Multi-agency coordination (mitigation: single platform with clear governance)
  • Transboundary disputes (mitigation: scientific allocation, neutral platform)
  • Informal water economy (mitigation: formalization incentives, tech enforcement)
  • Climate uncertainty (mitigation: ensemble modeling, adaptive management)
  • Digital divide (mitigation: SMS/voice access, localization in 20+ languages)
